entry.title: Re: Mass uploading sales orders via DTW, how can I trigge...
entry.content:
@jpfp ,

We face a similar issue with another tax engine.

The API call is only triggered by the UI, hence, DTW or any other integrations that create documents in the system will not contain tax calculation. The users must hit "calculate tax" SO and watch the engine populate tax line by line.

I don't see an alternative apart from entering the tax from the document upload, as suggested already by @Johan_Hakkesteegt.

Finally, it might worth checking with the vendor if they have another way to fetch tax calculations. In our case, they do. Basically, the document posting action triggers the API call (regardless its source), and the response populates the payload on the fly, which will be committed as transaction. So, there is no need to rely on Add-Ons and UI tricks to make it happen.

BR,
Felipe

entry.title: Re: Add Field in SO Form Template datasource
entry.content:
Hello @KhaingZinTun 

Thank you for providing the screenshots. If a field appears in the Sales Order SO form XML but has no value, it is most likely due to an incorrect node or path in the data source, or because the output item was created before the extension's publication. Can you verify that the size and dimensions specified in the product used for the test order are maintained?

Extend the data source and node correctly, then publish. Use Custom Fields and Logic ‚Üí Data Source Extensions. For SO confirmation, the data source is FDP_V1_ORDER_CONFIRM_SRV. Add the field to the Item ‚Üí Product path and publish. SAP Help Portal-Data Source Extensions

Regenerate the output item after publishing.
Create a new output or resend the existing one, then download the resulting XML. Note that existing outputs do not populate any new fields that are added; this is a known behaviour of SAP. SAP Support Portal-3076122 - Newly-added field via Data Source Extension is empty in the output XML file of an existing Sales Order

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: configuration steps for the MM module.
entry.content:
SAP doesn‚Äôt publish a single ‚Äúone‚Äëstop‚Äù IMG‚Äëstyle configuration manual for MM, whether in ECC or S/4HANA Public Cloud. In the Public Cloud edition, configuration is done through SSCUIs (Self‚ÄëService Configuration UIs) and guided by SAP Best Practices rather than the traditional IMG.

That said, there are some excellent resources you can use to build your workshop material:

SAP Best Practices Explorer / Process Navigator Contains scope items (e.g., Procurement of Direct Materials, Operational Procurement) with test scripts, configuration guides, and process flows. Each scope item has accelerators (PDFs, configuration steps, diagrams) you can use directly in your workshop.

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Sourcing and Procurement Explains features, SSCUIs, and integration points with FI/CO/PS.

entry.title: Re: VAT registers - sequential page numbering / to fullfi...
entry.content:
For the VAT register report RFUMSV00 / S_ALR_87100833 page numbering issue, SAP has explicitly documented that the problem occurs when you run the report in foreground. The correction is to always execute it in background or with ‚ÄúExecute and Print.‚Äù

SAP Note 719631 explains that if you run the report in foreground (‚ÄúExecute‚Äù), the page counter can reset. The recommendation is to use ‚ÄúExecute and Print‚Äù or background execution to ensure correct sequential numbering.

SAP Note 1263757 provides corrections for sequential numbering across months, especially when saving page numbers in table RFUMSV00_BAL_IT.

entry.title: Re: S/4 Public cloud - Service - repair in house subcontr...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, in-house repair processes are managed with the In-House Repair (3XK) scope item, while subcontractor work is handled through Service Procurement. The workflow usually starts with creating a repair order when customer equipment is received. This allows you to document the condition, required actions, and plan the repair steps. If part of the job needs to be outsourced, you can create a purchase order for the subcontractor and track the service through a service entry sheet.

Logistics are supported by outbound and inbound deliveries, which give visibility over the movement of equipment when it‚Äôs sent to and received back from the subcontractor. This ensures that customer property is tracked at every stage.

The setup is practical because it separates internal tasks from external ones but still maintains overall traceability. Businesses outside of SAP follow similar models. For instance, service providers such as PS Home Maintenance often complete general repair tasks internally while relying on trusted subcontractors for specialized work. The key is having a system that balances accountability with flexibility, and SAP‚Äôs combination of repair orders, procurement, and delivery tracking makes this possible in the cloud environment.

entry.title: Re: SAPF110V and SAPMF05A Program last changed user is DDIC
entry.content:
Go to SE38 or SE80, enter the program name (e.g. SAPF110V). Use Utilities ‚Üí Versions ‚Üí Version Management. If there are no versions, it means the program was never modified in your system. Standard SAP programs do not have version history unless they were changed via modification.

Transaction SE95 (Modification Browser). Search for object type Program and enter SAPF110V or SAPMF05A. If nothing is listed, it confirms no modifications exist.

Transaction SE03 ‚Üí ‚ÄúDisplay Object Directory Entries‚Äù ‚Üí check if the program is marked as SAP standard (original system = SAP).

Check SAP Note 1291031: ‚ÄúNo changes for user DDIC allowed‚Äù ‚Äî this confirms SAP‚Äôs policy that DDIC cannot be used to modify repository objects in customer systems

entry.title: Re: Unknown number in RefKey 1 field in Accounting Doc
entry.content:
How the Sort Key works is in the G/L master record (FS00 ‚Üí Company Code Data ‚Üí Control Data tab), the field Sort Key determines what value is copied into the Assignment field (ZUONR) or Reference Key fields (XREF1/2/3) when a posting is made. Sort Key 21 (Segment text), for example, pulls data from the document segment text into the assignment/reference field. Other sort keys can pull things like PO number, cost center, or document number automatically

To trace the value, go to FS00 for the G/L account used in your posting. On the Control Data tab, note the Sort Key. Use transaction OB16 to see what field that sort key is configured to pull from (e.g., PO number, segment text, etc.).

Display your accounting document in FB03. Drill down into the line item where Reference Key 1 is filled. Compare the value with the source field defined in the sort key. For example, if Sort Key = 014 (Purchase Order), the system will copy the PO number from BSEG‚ÄëEBELN into the assignment/reference field.

entry.title: #13 - How to change the IT contact
entry.content:
Importance of the IT Contact

When an SAP Contract is signed, a Technical Administrator (also called the IT Contact) is nominated on the contract.

The IT Contact should be a hands-on system administrator with the skills to manage and troubleshoot the system, not an executive. This individual should be accessible, responsive to SAP communications, and actively engaged with the project and business stakeholders.

The IT Contact will:

  • Receive all technical communications about the startup of the SAP product (including provisioning emails & welcome email)
  • Become an S-user administrator.

More details about users and authorizations are available here.

If you noticed that the SAP IT Contact is incorrect, please change them ASAP to avoid complication and any delay of the project.

How to change IT Contact

There are two options for changing the IT Contact

  1. SAP Onboarding Token ‚Äì this is a self-service option available for 2 months from order booking. Recommended if contract has not already started.
  2. SAP Support Incident ‚Äì recommended if token has expired or contract has already started.

SAP Onboarding Token

The Onboarding Token is a digital code found on the sales order and is active as soon as the sales order is received. The Token can be used by anyone on the customer side but can only be used once and must be used within two months of creation.

The person who uses the token becomes the new IT contact for that order.

Using the token has two significant results:

  1. That person will receive all technical communications about the startup of that SAP product (including provisioning emails & welcome email);
  2. That person will become an S-user administrator.

Please note, the new Contact IT will only receive above communications if the token is redeemed prior to the contract start date.

SAP Support Incident

In case the Onboarding Token has expired or has already been redeemed, you can still change the IT Contact by creating a Support Incident via SAP for Me.

Recommendation: create the incident with the subject: ‚ÄúRequest to Change the IT Contact Person‚Äù. In the text description, please include:

  • The name and email address of the current and desired IT Contact
  • The Reason for the change
  • If applicable, request to resend the provisioning emails to the new IT Contact

Find more details on the SAP KBA 1296527: How to create a support case.

In Conclusion

The IT contact plays a crucial role in provisioning your SAP systems effectively. It is essential to ensure that the right person within your organization is designated for this role to facilitate seamless operations and communications. If a change in IT contact is necessary, this blog has outlined a straightforward procedure to make the transition quickly and efficiently.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Check out other blogs from the series   Customer Onboarding at SAP
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About the authors:

  • Keith is a system access topic expert in the SAP customer onboarding team and is passionate about customers first successful login to SAP products and support systems.
  • Linh Hoang is a strategy and program manager for the customer onboarding at SAP, overlooking the onboarding journey cross-solution areas.

Having questions, comments or feedbacks? Don't hesitate to comment down below or contact @KeithB  or @Linh-Hoang.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: GRC, Trade and Tax with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
With this blog I will walk you through the selected key highlights for Governance, Risk, Compliance (GRC), Trade and Tax in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508:

In case you do not need all the information and just briefly want to get an overview of the release highlights, please watch the video below:

 
Video #1: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 GRC

This blog covers the following innovations:

SAP Risk and Assurance Management

  • Preconfigured business content to detect fraud and money laundering transactions (SAP Risk and Assurance Management)
  • Overview pages for controls
  • Overview pages for risks

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

  • Statutory reporting: mass action and scheduling
  • Malaysia e-invoicing: exchange of electronic invoices through the Peppol network
  • India Goods and services tax (GST) reporting - GSTR-1, GSTR-2A and GSTR-3B
  • Accelerated electronic document corrections with GenAI

SAP International Trade Management

  • Cloud BAdIs for Intrastat (BDT)
  • Localization option for Intrastat (BDT)
  • New compliance status for purchase orders
  • Trade classification proposals for custom tariff numbers and commodity codes
  • Audit trail for Watch List Screening

SAP Risk and Assurance Management

Preconfigured business content to detect fraud and money laundering transactions (SAP Risk and Assurance Management)

Fig #1 : preconfigured business content to detect fraud and money laundering transactions

SAP Risk and Assurance Management comes with predefined business content that you can use of the box, such as predefined automated procedures and controls, to minimize the effort of building your financial compliance management framework.

Value Proposition

  • Speed up usage with predefined business content for detection rules
  • Enable finance departments to detect fraud or suspicious payments

Capabilities

  • New automated procedures with a focus on anti-money laundering and fraud:
    • High-risk country incoming payments
      • Check incoming payments against list of countries or regions deemed to be high-risk
    • Payer name deviation in incoming payments
      • Check incoming payments against transferring vendor name.
    • Postings on expense accounts
    • Outgoing payments on expense accounts
    • IBAN deviations in incoming payments
    • Customer negative amount postings by user
    • Customer negative amount postings by ratio

For more information, see: Business Content for SAP Risk and Assurance Management

Overview pages for controls

 

Video #2: Demo Overview Page

This Overview page is designed to help our Compliance Managers save time by effectively monitoring progress & getting an instant overview that no critical control runs are missed and helping him quickly identifying and analyzing errors in work packages.

Value Proposition

  • Centralised information hub
  • Improved decision making through real time monitoring
  • Profit from early awareness and proactive operations

Capabilities

  • Operational dashboard for the compliance manager to get an overview of controls and work packages of the organisation
  • Overview on control performance results in time intervals, by control risk level and significance and  work packages by procedure run status
  • Ability to navigate to the specific risk from the overview page

For more information, see: Controls Analytics

Overview pages for risk management

Fig #2 : overview pages for risk management

A risk heat map is an important tool for a risk manager helping them identify, prioritize, and address risks, as well as communicate about risks with stakeholders.

Value Proposition

  • Gain real-time risk visibility
  • Improve the efficiency of the risk manager
  • Profit from early awareness and proactive risk management

Capabilities

  • Visualised dashboard that helps risk managers gain insights into the overall risk status of the organization
  • Heatmaps showing the current risk landscape
  • View risks by different dimensions, such as organization unit, risk category, and so on
  • Ability to navigate to the specific risk from the overview page

For more information, see: Risk Overview

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

Statutory reporting: mass action and scheduling

 

Video #3:  Statutory reporting: mass action and scheduling

Schedule Mass Action enables you to automate the generation of multiple report runs simultaneously and set them to recur at desired intervals. This feature is beneficial for streamlining reporting processes, saving time, and ensuring consistency in report generation.

Mass Action now also supports trigger of workflow approvals and submission of report runs electronically.

The Update Reporting Tasks feature allows you to instantly update specific reporting tasks for a desired reporting year through the reports dashboard.

A new submission status has now been introduced for the processing of runs with large volumes of documents. When a run involves more than 100 documents, the status will now display as Submission In Progress.

Benefits

  • Automate the approval and submission process, improving overall efficiency
  • Automate and schedule report generation, helping ensure consistency, improving efficiency, and reducing errors
  • Provide flexible options for defining report generation schedules
  • Improve efficiency and consistency in statutory reporting by streamlining the application of common properties across multiple reports
  • Introduce a separate option to create or update reporting tasks, providing users with the flexibility to create or update reporting tasks as and when desired, rather than wait for the technical job to run

For more information please refer to :

  • Help Document: Trigger Mass Action
  • Define Statutory Reports
  • Help Document: Electronic Submission of Reports
  • Help Document: Mass Action
  • Help Document: Schedule Mass Action
  • Help Document: Update Reporting Tasks
  • Run Statutory Reports

Malaysia e-invoicing: exchange of electronic invoices through the Peppol network

Fig #3: Malaysia e-invoicing: exchange of electronic invoices through the Peppol network Malaysia e-invoicing regulation:

  • When you sell goods or services to a customer, you should create and submit an electronic invoice to the Inland Revenue Board of Malaysia (IRBM) first for clearance. Once the IRBM clears the electronic invoice, you can then send it to the customer.
  • Once the electronic invoice is cleared, you can then send it to your business partner over the Peppol network with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.
  • As of May 28, 2025, official accreditation of SAP as a service provider and Peppol-ready solution provider by the Malaysia Digital Economy Corporation (MDEC).

Exchanging electronic documents (invoices, credit notes, debit notes) through the Peppol network is enabled.

More details: Sending Electronic Invoices to Customers Using Peppol

India Goods and services tax (GST) reporting - GSTR-1, GSTR-2A and GSTR-3B

Fig #4: India Goods and services tax (GST) reporting - GSTR-1, GSTR-2A and GSTR-3B

  • Monthly outward supplies return (GSTR-1):
    • Automated retrieval of auto-populated GSTR-1 from the goods and service tax network (GSTN) (in a draft return) and comparison against business transactions in the sales register in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • Review and finalization of the draft return, including the digital signature and filing
  • Inward purchase invoices and reconciliation:
    • Automatically retrieve GSTR-2A invoices from the GSTN portal and reconcile them against business transactions in the purchase register in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Monthly consolidated tax return (GSTR-3B):
    • Automated retrieval of data from GSTN (manual input of 2B data), review, and manual adjustment with traceability and filing

More details: India GSTR reports

Accelerated electronic document corrections with GenAI

Fig #5: Accelerated electronic document corrections with GenAI

As countries rapidly adopt e-invoicing mandates, tax accountants face growing challenges in handling complex, technical errors from high-volume electronic document exchanges. Joule with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance enables tax accountants to quickly understand these errors via clear explanations in natural language, without digging into complex formats and technical descriptions. This results in faster processing, reduced penalties, and improved cash flow‚Äîsaving both time and money.‚Äã

Value Proposition‚Äã

  • Easy to understand explanations to complex electronic document errors.‚Äã
  • Uncover error root causes faster with resolution recommendations.‚Äã
  • Boost productivity and drive better business results.‚Äã
  • Better user experience with native language support.‚Äã

Capabilities‚Äã

  • User can simply ask Joule for error explanation in natural language.‚Äã
  • Get easy to understand context aware explanations.‚Äã
  • Error explanation include root cause and recommended resolution steps‚Äã
  • User can explore details via relevant SAP Help Documentation links provided.‚Äã
  • User can leverage multi-language capabilities for better experience. ‚Äã

For more information, see: Help Document: Electronic Document Error Handling with SAP Joule

SAP International Trade Management

Cloud BAdIs for Intrastat (BDT)

Fig #6: Cloud BAdIs for Intrastat (BDT)

Three cloud BAdIs are provided to select additional documents and change detail data. 

  • INTRASTAT_GET_BILLING_DOCS: to select additional billing documents not selected by standard selection report
  • INTRASTAT_GET_PURCHASE_DOCS: to select additional purchase documents not selected by standard selection report
  • INTRASTAT_CHANGE_DATA: to change data in documents selected by selection reports (which are selected via both standard and BAdIs)

For more information, please check New BAdI for Intrastat: Get Additional Purchasing Documents

Localization option for Intrastat (BDT) Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Cyprus, Malta

Fig #7: Localization option for Intrastat (BDT) Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Cyprus, Malta

Customers that want to implement Intrastat for non-standard countries, must use the SAP Central Business Configuration tool to access the new configuration items.

Configuration item 1: Basic data for Intrastat

Configuration item 2: Default values for Intrastat

Configuration item 3: Data selection for Intrastat

For more information, please see New Configuration Items for Intrastat Non-Standard Countries

New compliance status for purchase orders

Fig #8: New compliance status for purchase orders

With this feature, a Trade Compliance specialist can check on dedicated international trade compliance statuses for embargo, legal control, and screening in purchase orders.

Value Proposition

  • Gain transparency on dedicated statuses of international trade compliance checks in purchase orders
  • Help ensure frictionless international trade processes

Capabilities 

  • Dedicated international trade compliance statuses for embargo, legal control, and screening in purchase orders
  • New status fields to be available on purchase order header and item level in the purchase order advanced app
  • New status fields substitute the compliance status by the on-hold status in the purchase order

For more information, see Dedicated Trade Compliance Statuses in Purchase Orders‚Äã and Product Compliance in Purchase Orders

Trade classification proposals for custom tariff numbers and commodity codes

 

Video #4: Trade classification proposals for custom tariff numbers and commodity codes

Increase productivity and leverage already existing trade product classifications for your decisions with AI-assisted trade classification proposals with fuzzy search

  • Step 1: Enable generation classification proposals for each numbering scheme
  • Step 2: Schedule jobs for classification proposals
  • Step 3: Optimize generated trade classification proposals (optional)

For more information, see:  Product Classification Proposal

Audit trail for Watch List Screening

 

Video #5: Audit trail for Watch List Screening

With this app you can display an audit trail for your screening requests. The app shows an overview of all screening requests. You can navigate to single screening requests for more information.

Value Proposition

  • Support audits by providing data

Capabilities 

  • The app shows an overview of all screening requests. You can navigate to single screening requests for more information.

For more information, see: Display Audit Trail

Thanks for taking the time to read this blog.

More Information

If you are interested in the latest and greatest blog posts on GRC Trade and Tax , please have a look at the collection blog.

Check out our community page to ask your questions and engage with the experts.

Follow the PSCC_Enablement tag to stay up to date with our latest blog posts. Follow us on @SAP

entry.title: Re: Disable notification unread documents / new workflow item in inbox
entry.content:
Hi Mark,

Are you wondering if notifications can only be sent to specific users - but not ALL the recipients of workflow tasks?  From my experience, this is a tale as old as time.  

I would work on configuring Extended Notifications to send email for the desired workflow tasks (to all users) and then help your users who do NOT want to see notifications set up filters in their Outlook.     The heavy lifting is getting the notifications configured and sent out.  It is an easy thing (imo) for users to set their outlook filters and then they can forget about it.  As long as you are certain that the workflow tasks are being delivered to the correct users, this shouldn't be a problem.

Just my 2 cents,
Sue

entry.title: Calculation View Features of 2025 QRC3
entry.content:
Within the time frame of 2025 Q3, several new calculation view features have been released in SAP Business Application Studio when connected to SAP HANA Cloud database QRC3. Some of these features are highlighted below. You can find examples that illustrate the individual features here. An overview of features of other releases can be found here.

Additional Vector Engine Functions

Leverage the following additional vector engine functions in expressions:

 
- CARDINALITY
- L2NORM
- L2NORMALIZE
- MEMBER_AT
- SUB_VECTOR

Additional Join Type: Semi Join

Semi Joins are optimized for filtering data based on tabular filter values. The left side of the Semi Join provides the data and the right side the values that should be kept from the left side. In addition to performance optimizations for these type of scenarios Semi Joins also ignore duplicates in the filter values.

Semi Joins return records from the left source only if their values are contained in the right data source.  In the example above from the left data source only records with values Germany and Walldorf match to entries in the right data source if joined on both columns. Therefore, only the single record is returned. The multiple entries for Germany and Walldorf on the right side do not lead to a multiplication of the records on the left side.

Using Semi Joins together with the option Dynamic Join allows to decide at runtime which columns have to match for keeping records on the left side. For example, when asking for country and city records with non-matching city values will be removed while they are kept if only country is requested. If no join columns are requested with option Dynamic Join all data from the left data source are returned.

Use Semi Joins if you want to filter data based on matching entries in another tabular data source.

Restrict Search to Local Objects in Add Data Source Dialog

To only search for local objects set the flag Show only local objects in the Add Data Source dialog:

The last choice of Show only local objects  in your developer space becomes the new default for calculation views.

Use option to quickly find objects in your HDI container

Align Alias Names

The alias names for columns of Dimension views in Star Join nodes can now be generated using the dialog Align Column Alias Names:

 

The dialog offers several options to pre/postfix the column names:

Use this option to align the naming of Dimension Columns in Star Joins and to provide more insights into data lineage

 

Mass Generation of Labels of Dimension View Columns

You can use expressions to generate alias labels for columns of Dimension Views that are used in Star Joins using button Generate Alias Labels:


The following expression replaces "_cv" with an empty string in the Alias Name:

Use this option to easily generate speaking labels

 

Focus on Reduced Memory Consumption During Creation of Query Snapshots

Use flag "Minimize Memory Consumption" to focus on reduced memory consumption during query snapshot creation if query snapshot creation time is not critical. This will leverage the spill to disk method:
 

 

MDS Cubes

Several innovations for MDS Cubes target scenarios in which MDS Cube processing should be influenced at query runtime. To this end the conversion option "Query Execution" had been introduced:

With setting "Query Execution" conversion is done at query execution and not at MDS Cube loading time and thus can be influence by input parameter values on the fly.

Additional options become available with this setting:

Additional Currency Conversion Options with Setting "Query Execution"

  • Decimal Shifts
  • Shift Back
  • Rounding
  • Reverse Look Up

Unit Conversion with Setting "Query Execution"

 Unit conversion can now also be combined with setting Query Execution:

Gain more flexibility for conversions at query runtime and use input parameter values on the fly.

Support of Input Parameters

It is now possible to materialize MDS Cube data for different combinations of input parameter values at MDS Cube loading time. This provides the flexibility to use input parameters at reporting time. The combinations of input parameter values that should be materialized have to be explicitly listed. Make sure to materialize all combinations that are relevant for potential queries. If no materialized value combination is found the query will be canceled. Input Parameters used in currency/unit conversion don't require materialization with mode "Query Execution".
Leverage the flexibility of input parameters in combination with MDS Cubes
 

Switch between Structured Filters and Privileges

When opening an analytic privilege in the graphical editor the Save As... option allows to store the privilege in a different format, e.g., as a structured filter or privilege:

 

This way it becomes easier to change between the different types of analytic privileges. SQL expressions and Procedure Based specifications will be retained while Graphical specifications will be lost.
 
The Apply Privileges type of a calculation view must correspond to the privilege type of the analytic privilege that uses the calculation view as secured model. Therefore, make sure to also switch the privilege check of the calculation view before deploying all objects together.

Flexibly choose which type of analytic privilege you would like to use

entry.title: Re: WIP source type "N - Costs Not to Be Included" doesn'...
entry.content:
In your case, why this happens is because, in classic WIP (period‚Äëend), costs with source type N are simply ignored in the calculation. No posting attempt is made. In event‚Äëbased WIP, every posting to an order is intercepted in real time. The system must decide immediately:

  • Should this cost be included in WIP?
  • If not, how should it be posted?

If the G/L account is not assigned in the EB WIP configuration, the system cannot resolve the posting logic and raises the error: ‚ÄúAssign source G/L account XXXXXXXX for event‚Äëbased WIP posting.‚Äù

So even for ‚Äúnot relevant‚Äù costs, the system still requires a mapping entry to know how to handle them.

What you need to do is check Account Determination for EB WIP. Even for Source Type N, you must assign the G/L account here. This tells the system ‚ÄúYes, this account exists, but it is excluded from WIP.‚Äù

After correcting the assignment, go to Postprocess Event‚ÄëBased Postings ‚Äì Product Costing. Reprocess the failed postings. The error should clear.

Orders with unprocessed EB WIP postings cannot be settled. That‚Äôs why even after TECO/DLV, the settlement job fails. Once you fix the mapping and reprocess, settlement will work as expected.

entry.title: Re: Printing of HU_shipping label
entry.content:
In Public Cloud, Output Management (BRF+) controls when forms (like HU labels) are printed. The trigger event available for HU labels is ‚ÄúHU created‚Äù, not ‚ÄúHU packed.‚Äù There is no released API like API_FORM_PRINT_SRV in Public Cloud to directly call the form print service. The recommended approach is to use the business object APIs (e.g. API_HANDLING_UNIT_SRV or API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV) and then trigger an OutputRequest programmatically if you want to control when the label is printed.

So you have couple of options

Adjust OPD rules so that the HU label is not printed automatically at HU creation. Instead, configure a custom output type that you trigger later (e.g. after packing completion).

Use API_HANDLING_UNIT_SRV to detect when the HU has been packed. Then call the OutputRequest service to trigger the HU label print. This requires a small custom extension (side‚Äëby‚Äëside app on BTP).

entry.title: How to add entries to transports to delete objects which were deleted in Dev and not in TADIR?
entry.content:
Hi community,
we have created a solution in abap and all development is done in one development-package in our own namespace. We delivered it by creating a transport-request with all objects of that development-package on it.

Now we have a newer version of the solution. But some development-objects where deleted in the development since the first release. We will deliver the software again as a big transport with all development-objects of our development-package on it. 
We create this transport programmatically by selecting all objects from table TADIR for our development-package. Then we use the function-module "TRINT_OBJECTS_CHECK_AND_INSERT" to put all the selected development objects on the transport. 

But this transport now should not contain only all available development-objects. It shell also contain all development-objects which were deleted since the last transport. So we read table "E071" for the transport of the previous release, check all entries if they still exists in TADIR and for all found no longer existing development objects we want a "delete"-entry in the transport request. 
First try was to use the same function module and setting the value for "objfunc" to "D" for deletion. But the Functionmodule seems to check all added entries for existence against TADIR (throws exception "show_only_tadir_missing").

Principally it should work to add such deletion entries to a transport because i saw it in other software-packages we installed by using transports. The E071 for such transport shows also only a value of "D" for Attribute OBJFUNC.

So my question is how to achive this. is there any special parameter in function-module "TRINT_OBJECTS_CHECK_AND_INSERT" or do i have to use another function-module or abap-class/-method?

Any idea would be hardly welcome.
kind regards
Matthias

entry.title: Re: Building Custom Authentication in SAP CAP
entry.content:
Yes, it should ne technically possible.

To create a custom authentication layer that extends IAS/XSUAA with your own security rules, you have two paths:

  1. Inspect the logic in the standard CAP file (e.g., in the Node.js implementation: \node_modules\@sap\cds\lib\srv\middlewares\auth\ias-auth.js) and replicate/adapt the essential token handling steps in your own custom middleware.

  2. Build from scratch üôÇ

Preview of ias-auth.js:

const cds = require('../../../index.js')
const LOG = cds.log('auth')

const {
  createSecurityContext,
  Token,
  IdentityService,
  XsuaaService,
  XsuaaToken,
  errors: { ValidationError }
} = require('./xssec')

module.exports = function ias_auth(config) {
  // cds.env.requires.auth.known_claims is not an official config!
  const { kind, credentials, config: serviceConfig = {}, known_claims = KNOWN_CLAIMS } = config
  const skipped_attrs = known_claims.reduce((a, x) => ((a[x] = 1), a), {})

  if (!credentials)
    throw new Error(
      `Authentication kind "${kind}" configured, but no IAS instance bound to application. ` +
        'Either bind an IAS instance, or switch to an authentication kind that does not require a binding.'
    )

  // enable signature cache by default
  serviceConfig.validation ??= {}
  if (!('signatureCache' in serviceConfig.validation)) serviceConfig.validation.signatureCache = { enabled: true }
  // activate decode cache if not already done or explicitely disabled by setting Token.decodeCache to false or undefined
  if (Token.decodeCache === null) Token.enableDecodeCache()

  const auth_service = new IdentityService(credentials, serviceConfig)
  const user_factory = get_user_factory(credentials, skipped_attrs)

  /*
   * re validation:
   *   if the request goes to the cert url, then we should validate the token.
   *   however, this requires header "x-forwarded-client-cert" which requires additional configuration in the approuter ("forwardAuthCertificates: true").
   *   also, we currently get the non-cert route attached to the application as well (-> adjust "cds add mta"?), for which validation would always fail.
   *   by default, the approuter is configured to use the non-cert route ("url: ~{srv-url}" instead of "url: ~{srv-cert-url}").
   *   if the developer explicitely changes to the cert route, then we can expect him/her to also configure cert forwarding.
   *   hence, if there is no explicit validation configuration by the app, we can and should create a service with validation enabled and use if for the cert route.
   *   this way, we validate if possible with the least amount of custom configuration.
   */

  const should_validate =
    process.env.VCAP_APPLICATION &&
    JSON.parse(process.env.VCAP_APPLICATION).application_uris?.some(uri => uri.match(/\.cert\.|\.mesh\.cf\./))
  const validation_configured = serviceConfig.validation?.x5t?.enabled != null || serviceConfig.validation?.proofToken?.enabled != null

  let validating_auth_service
  if (should_validate && !validation_configured) {
    const _serviceConfig = { ...serviceConfig }
    _serviceConfig.validation = { x5t: { enabled: true }, proofToken: { enabled: true } }
    validating_auth_service = new IdentityService(credentials, _serviceConfig)
  }

  // xsuaa fallback allows to also accept XSUAA tokens during migration to IAS
  // automatically enabled if xsuaa credentials are available
  let xsuaa_service, xsuaa_user_factory
  if (cds.env.requires.xsuaa?.credentials) {
    const { credentials: xsuaa_credentials, config: xsuaa_serviceConfig = {} } = cds.env.requires.xsuaa
    xsuaa_service = new XsuaaService(xsuaa_credentials, xsuaa_serviceConfig)
    const get_xsuaa_user_factory = require('./jwt-auth')._get_user_factory
    xsuaa_user_factory = get_xsuaa_user_factory(xsuaa_credentials, xsuaa_credentials.xsappname, 'xsuaa')
  }

  return async function ias_auth(req, _, next) {
    if (!req.headers.authorization) return next()

    try {
      const _auth_service =
        validating_auth_service && req.hostname.match(/\.cert\.|\.mesh\.cf\./) ? validating_auth_service : auth_service
      const securityContext = await createSecurityContext(xsuaa_service ? [_auth_service, xsuaa_service] : _auth_service, { req })
      const ctx = cds.context
      ctx.user = securityContext.token instanceof XsuaaToken ? xsuaa_user_factory(securityContext) : user_factory(securityContext)
      ctx.tenant = securityContext.token.getZoneId()
      // REVISIT: remove compat in cds^10
      Object.defineProperty(req, 'authInfo', {
        get() {
          cds.utils.deprecated({ kind: 'API', old: 'cds.context.http.req.authInfo', use: 'cds.context.user.authInfo' })
          return securityContext
        }
      })
    } catch (e) {
      if (e instanceof ValidationError) {
        LOG.warn('Unauthenticated request: ', e)
        return next(401)
      }
      LOG.error('Error while authenticating user: ', e)
      return next(500)
    }

    next()
  }
}

function get_user_factory(credentials, skipped_attrs) {
  return function user_factory(securityContext) {
    const tokenInfo = securityContext.token
    const payload = tokenInfo.getPayload()

    /*
     * NOTE:
     *  for easier migration, xssec will offer IAS without policies via so-called XsuaaFallback.
     *  in that case, we would need to add the roles here based on the tokenInfo (similar to xsuaa-auth).
     *  however, it is not yet clear where the roles will be stored in IAS' tokenInfo object.
     *  further, stakeholders would need to configure the "extension" programmatically (e.g., in a custom server.js).
     */

    const clientid = tokenInfo.getClientId()
    if (clientid === payload.sub) {
      //> grant_type === client_credentials or x509
      const roles = { 'system-user': 1 }
      if (Array.isArray(payload.ias_apis)) payload.ias_apis.forEach(r => (roles[r] = 1))
      if (clientid === credentials.clientid) roles['internal-user'] = 1
      else delete roles['internal-user']

      const user = new cds.User({ id: 'system', roles, authInfo: securityContext })
      // REVISIT: remove compat in cds^10
      Object.defineProperty(user, 'tokenInfo', {
        get() {
          // prettier-ignore
          cds.utils.deprecated({ kind: 'API', old: 'cds.context.user.tokenInfo', use: 'cds.context.user.authInfo.token' })
          return securityContext.token
        }
      })
      return user
    }

    // add all unknown attributes to req.user.attr in order to keep public API small
    const attr = {}
    for (const key in payload) {
      if (key in skipped_attrs)
        continue // REVISIT: Why do we need to do that?
      else attr[key] = payload[key]
    }

    // REVISIT: just don't such things, please! -> We're just piling up tech dept through tons of unoficcial long tail APIs like that!
    // REVISIT: looks like wrong direction to me, btw
    // same api as xsuaa-auth for easier migration
    if (attr.user_name) attr.logonName = attr.user_name
    if (attr.given_name) attr.givenName = attr.given_name
    if (attr.family_name) attr.familyName = attr.family_name

    const user = new cds.User({ id: payload.sub, attr, authInfo: securityContext })
    // REVISIT: remove compat in cds^10
    Object.defineProperty(user, 'tokenInfo', {
      get() {
        cds.utils.deprecated({ kind: 'API', old: 'cds.context.user.tokenInfo', use: 'cds.context.user.authInfo.token' })
        return securityContext.token
      }
    })
    return user
  }
}

// REVISIT: Why do we need to know and do that?
const KNOWN_CLAIMS = Object.values({
  /*
   * JWT claims (https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7519#section-4)
   */
  ISSUER: 'iss',
  SUBJECT: 'sub',
  AUDIENCE: 'aud',
  EXPIRATION_TIME: 'exp',
  NOT_BEFORE: 'nbf',
  ISSUED_AT: 'iat',
  JWT_ID: 'jti',
  /*
   * TokenClaims (com.sap.cloud.security.token.TokenClaims)
   */
  // ISSUER: "iss", //> already in JWT claims
  IAS_ISSUER: 'ias_iss',
  // EXPIRATION: "exp", //> already in JWT claims
  // AUDIENCE: "aud", //> already in JWT claims
  // NOT_BEFORE: "nbf", //> already in JWT claims
  // SUBJECT: "sub", //> already in JWT claims
  // USER_NAME: 'user_name', //> do not exclude
  // GIVEN_NAME: 'given_name', //> do not exclude
  // FAMILY_NAME: 'family_name', //> do not exclude
  // EMAIL: 'email', //> do not exclude
  SAP_GLOBAL_SCIM_ID: 'scim_id',
  SAP_GLOBAL_USER_ID: 'user_uuid', //> exclude for now
  SAP_GLOBAL_ZONE_ID: 'zone_uuid',
  // GROUPS: 'groups', //> do not exclude
  AUTHORIZATION_PARTY: 'azp',
  CNF: 'cnf',
  CNF_X5T: 'x5t#S256',
  // own
  APP_TENANT_ID: 'app_tid'
})

entry.title: Secure Your Digital Journey with SAP CIAM
entry.content:
Secure Your Digital Journey with SAP CIAM 

Over the years, working in customer experience and digital technologies, I have witnessed the rapid evolution of both customers and the infrastructure needed to serve them.  When you consider the ‚Äúcustomer,‚Äù the need to understand who they are has become a central focus of the user experience. The world of digital identity has continuously adapted. Social logins once felt like the future‚Äînow, passwordless or passkey authentication is a requirement. Data privacy has shifted from an afterthought to a boardroom priority, largely driven by regulations like GDPR, CCPA, and others. What used to be considered "good enough" security no longer suffices, as becoming the subject of a data breach headline is a risk no company can afford.. 

Even my daughter now warns me not to share her identity online, as I don‚Äôt have her consent‚Äîproof that awareness of digital risks is becoming second nature to the next generation. In this new era, trust isn't a nice-to-have; it‚Äôs the foundation of every customer interaction. 

That‚Äôs why Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) is a critical part of any modern digital strategy and future-forward IT landscape. When organizations get digital identity right, they unlock more than just security‚Äîthey create better, more trusted customer experiences at every touchpoint. 

 

Bridge the Gap Between Experience and Trust 

In today's digital-first landscape, businesses must navigate the challenge of delivering seamless customer experiences while ensuring robust data protection‚Äîa balance that is crucial for building trust with increasingly privacy-conscious consumers. However, many organizations are stuck navigating data silos, which fragment customer insights and prevent a unified understanding of their audience.  

SAP CIAM offers a comprehensive solution to these challenges by unifying data management, enhancing security frameworks, and simplifying privacy compliance. It empowers businesses to protect against threats, manage identities efficiently, and offer personalized user experiences that foster customer loyalty. 

SAP CIAM overcomes the limitations of outdated systems and enables organizations to confidently: 

  1. Secure users 
  1. Reduce privacy concerns 
  1. Scale efficiently 

 

  1. Secure Users and Safeguard Data  

Concerned about data breaches? SAP CIAM is engineered to protect your customer data and minimize security risks, building trust between you and your customers. By prioritizing robust threat detection and protection, this solution ensures your business remains secure, fostering loyalty and reinforcing customer confidence in sharing their data.   

  • Access real-time password suggestions 
  • Utilize built-in screen sets for password updates 
  • Generate one-time passwords 
  • Integrate with external identity services 
  • Enable biometric sign-in for secure login 
  • Harness AI risk-based authentication 

 

For a deeper look at how SAP CIAM addresses today‚Äôs evolving security landscape, join us at SAP TechEd on November 6 for a dedicated CIAM security session. Register here to secure your spot and learn more. 

 

  1. Reduce Privacy Compliance Risk 

Keeping up with evolving privacy regulations can be daunting. SAP CIAM simplifies these challenges through efficient consent management capabilities, enabling businesses to adhere to global standards like ISO, BSI, and SOC 2. With user-friendly self-service portals, SAP CIAM respects customer privacy while maintaining compliance‚Äîultimately strengthening trusting relationships. 

  • Capture consent across all channels 
  • Customize for privacy policies and brand 
  • Configure single sign-on (SSO) 
  • Enable global access 

 

  1. Increase Efficiency at Scale 

Worried about system overload during peak times? SAP CIAM effortlessly manages traffic spikes, supporting billions of unique identities and transactions monthly. This capability allows businesses to capitalize on each opportunity without technical setbacks or undue stress on IT teams. With 347 million active users across 85 thousand sites, SAP CIAM is a proven solution for large-scale digital operations. 

  • Design and execute identity flows 
  • Duplicate site configurations and settings 
  • Offer OOTB, OIDC-compliant login experiences 
  • Create identity screens with drag-and-drop 

 

Elevate Your Identity Strategy with SAP CIAM 

SAP CIAM empowers businesses to bolster their security measures, ensure data privacy compliance, and efficiently scale their digital operations. Additionally, it offers pre-configured connectivity with over 60 SAP products, including SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP S/4HANA, SAP Customer Experience solutions, and SAP cloud ERP solutions, enhancing integration across your enterprise. 

Incorporating SAP CIAM into your digital strategy could be the next step toward elevating your business with enhanced security, data protection, and scalability. 

 

Learn more here.

I would now like to improve this flow as follows:

If the form was filled in by an existing customer (aka the Origin SAP_C4C_BUPA exists), then I want to fill up an additional field on the lead in C4C called "Exsting Customer" with the value "Yes". And if the formed was filled in by a new prospect, then this field should be "No".

I can add two "Create Lead" tasks in my campaign flow, and put a Filter live target group on each to split these two cases.

But, I cannot find how to pass the custom field value to C4C. I don't find a way to add a custom field to the "Create Lead" action. 

Is there some way by which I can do this?

entry.title: Re: Charge calculation - FTL - charging configuration by...
entry.content:
Hi, 

even though the case was hopefully solved in the last ten years, I would like to share, what most probably caused the 'multiplication' issue.


In the definition of the Charge Type, there is a checkbox 'Chrge Ty. Grping', when this is NOT checked, it causes this 'multiplication of the correct rate by the number of items considered in the grouping'.

Cheers,

Robert

entry.title: A day in the life of a developer for cloud ERP at SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
For me as a developer, TechEd is like being a kid in a candy store. Everywhere I look there are new tools, frameworks, and patterns that I want to try out. The best part is that I do not just hear about them, I actually get to test them in hands-on sessions and discuss them directly with the people who build them.

At TechEd 2025 in Berlin my agenda is packed with sessions where I can dive into code, explore AI-driven capabilities like Joule, and understand how to build scalable extensions for cloud ERP applications.

Day 1

  • 9:30 AM - 9:50 AM CET
    CT1234 | SAP BTP as the foundation for Partner SaaS Solutions
  • 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET
    AD162 | Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities
  • 12:30 PM - 2:30 PM CET
    AD169 | Empower your enterprise: Integrate custom AI agents with any system
  • 2:30 PM - 3:15 PM CET
    DT201 | Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP

Day 2

  • 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET:
    DT261 | Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP 
  • 1:30 PM - 1:55 PM CET:
    ST118 | The future of enterprise automation: Workflows, Joule skills, and AI agents
  • 2:15 PM - 3:00 PM CET:
    DT200 | Unravel the mysteries of clean core extensions in SAP Cloud ERP Private
  • 3:15 PM - 4:00 PM CET:
    AD100 | Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build
  • 4:15 PM - 5:00 PM CET:
    DT104 | Scalable extensions for SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Cloud ERP Private

Day 3

  • 9:00 AM - 9:25 AM CET:
    ST113 | Journey to unified extensibility in SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
  • 10:00 AM - 10:45 AM:
    DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP with SAP and Accenture
  • 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM CET:
    DT265 | Provision and extend multitenant solutions based on CAP for SAP Cloud ERP

Final thoughts

What I value most about TechEd is that I get to experiment with real code and frameworks that I can immediately take back to my projects. This year‚Äôs agenda gives me everything I want as a developer: ABAP Cloud in action, clean core best practices, and plenty of opportunities to explore how Joule and AI agents can enhance my development work.

When I return from Berlin, I know I will bring back not just notes, but working examples, patterns I can reuse, and new skills that will help me deliver extensions for cloud ERP applications.

Save the date and register today
 November 4-6, 2025 
SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual

entry.title: Success Factor ecp to S4H Public Cloud Integration
entry.content:
In S4H we have only one Controlling Area A000 and in Sucess Factor Payroll we have multiple Controlling areas

While Using PA20 in ECP the system is checking with S4H config which are related to Controlling Area, 

Ask is how to handle this cases , i mean while with S4H the the system should check One Controlling Area , Mapping needs to be done where we can do Mapping 

Ex    S4H - A000 and ECP  we have 1000,2000,3000 all these needs to be mapped to A000 while checking in the S4H
